channel.title: Pvp loot 508
channel.description:
any one know how to add pvp loot on a 508 bulby source ?? i want random drops when i kill players in bh,pvp,wildy,clanwars just started coding 508s hope u can help me realy need help :D
thank you

item.title: Pvp loot 508
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

Let me know if it does.
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 21, 2009, 05:22:40 am[/size][hr]Oh sorry. Replace you whole death method with this

 /**
     * Death data.
     */
public static int FOODdrop[] = {385, 391, 315, 379};
public static int randomFOODdrop()
{
return FOODdrop[(int)(Math.random()*FOODdrop.length)];
}
public static int PVPdrop[] = 

{4214,4224,4153,4153,4224,4153,12842,12842,1037,11730,11732,11732,1540,1540,4151,1149,1149,

1149,2368,2366,1305,1305,1377,1377,3140,3204,3204,3204,4087,4087,4585,4587,5698,5698,5698};
public static int randomPVPdrop()
{
return PVPdrop[(int)(Math.random()*PVPdrop.length)];
}
    public void applyDead() {
        if (deathDelay >= 7) {
  if (faceToReq != 65535) {
                requestFaceTo(65535);
            }
        }


        requestAnim(7197, 0);
        if (deathDelay <= 0) {
{
Engine.items.createGroundItem(526, 1, absX, absY, heightLevel, "");
Engine.items.createGroundItem(385, 1, absX, absY, heightLevel, "");
Engine.items.createGroundItem(randomPVPdrop(), 1, absX, absY, heightLevel, "");
Engine.items.createGroundItem(randomFOODdrop(), 1, absX, absY, heightLevel, "");
Engine.items.createGroundItem(995, Misc.random(50000), absX, absY, heightLevel, "");
Engine.items.createGroundItem(385, 1, absX, absY, heightLevel, "");
Engine.items.createGroundItem(385, 1, absX, absY, heightLevel, "");
Engine.items.createGroundItem(385, 1, absX, absY, heightLevel, "");
Engine.items.createGroundItem(385, 1, absX, absY, heightLevel, "");
Engine.items.createGroundItem(385, 1, absX, absY, heightLevel, "");
}

            frames.sendMessage(this, "<img=1><col=FF0000>Oh dead you have died!<img=1>");
         


			if(bountyArea()) {
				Engine.bountyhunter.leaveBounty(this);
				}

Read full topic
